meanings.definition: To perform as a musician or entertainer.
meanings.sent1: She loves gigging at local cafes on weekends.
meanings.sent2: The band will be gigging at the festival next month.
meanings.sent3: The cat started gigging on the piano keys, creating a funny tune.
meanings.sent4: His fingers danced on the guitar strings, gigging out a lively melody.
meanings.sent5: The stage lights shimmered as she began gigging, captivating the audience.

meanings.definition: A temporary job or engagement, especially in the music industry.
meanings.sent1: He took on a gigging as a drummer for a local band.
meanings.sent2: Finding gigging opportunities can be challenging for new musicians.
meanings.sent3: The gigging at the club paid well for just a few hours of work.
meanings.sent4: Her gigging as a backup singer was like a stepping stone to bigger stages.
meanings.sent5: The gigging at the wedding kept the guests entertained all night.
